meanings.sent1: She spent hours precising her research paper to ensure every detail was accurate.
meanings.sent2: The scientist precised the measurements to avoid any margin of error.
meanings.sent3: He was so focused on precising his essay that he forgot to eat lunch.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in precising the instructions was like a surgeon's skill with a scalpel.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush moved with precision, precising each stroke to create a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To limit or restrict (something) in order to make it more concise.
meanings.sent1: The editor precised the article by removing unnecessary paragraphs.
meanings.sent2: She precised her speech to fit within the time limit of five minutes.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would precising his dessert intake to avoid gaining weight.
meanings.sent4: The teacher precised the assignment guidelines to ensure clarity for the students.
meanings.sent5: The chef precised the recipe by simplifying the ingredients for easy understanding.

meanings.definition: To clarify or define (something) in a more specific way.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer precised the terms of the contract to avoid any misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: She precised her goals for the project to ensure everyone was on the same page.
meanings.sent3: He precised his directions to the lost tourists, guiding them back to the main road.
meanings.sent4: The author precised the plot of the story, leaving no room for confusion.
meanings.sent5: The teacher precised the lesson plan, breaking down complex topics into simple concepts.
